This is an emerging, rapidly changing situation and Hansen School District will follow the guidance of South Central Public Health as it progresses. For questions please contact your physician or the local department of health. We encourage you to keep up to date about 2019-nCoV in our area, you will find links to information on the What is Coronavirus page
Hello Hansen SD #415, Parents, Students, Patrons, and Staff:

As many of you have heard, the Idaho State Board of Education voted to extend the soft closure of Idaho schools through the rest of the year with the caveat that a local board could decide to reopen if social distancing requirements are lifted and state-wide criteria are met (criterion will be developed over the coming week and any decision to reopen would be done in coordination with the local health department). This decision effectively extends the soft closure here in Hansen for the remainder of the 19-20 school year. For now, I encourage all staff, students, and families to plan as if distance learning will continue for the remainder of the year.

Our administrators will be working with teachers to identify and communicate the vital things we need students to master to close out the year. Our staff has appreciated all the support the families of our students have given to assist in their children(s) education during this unprecedented time. Let's continue to work together to make the next couple of months the best they can be!

As the situation with COVID-19 changes so rapidly, please know our intent will be to do everything we can for our seniors and their graduation. We will continue to provide district updates as the weeks progress.

Sincerely,
David Carson
Superintendent Hansen School District #415

The Idaho State Board of Education approved a “soft close” of the state’s schools until April 20. This means all Idaho students including ours in Hansen will not return to campuses throughout Idaho until at least Monday, April 20.

The State Board directed districts to provide instructional opportunities to the best of their capacity during this closure recognizing many districts are currently on Spring Break. Our teachers spent last week preparing their classes for online learning. Your students should receive information from their teachers about how to proceed during the closure once spring break is over. Please encourage your children to enjoy the remainder of Spring Break.

Our school board is continually monitoring the situation and will meet on Friday. March 27th @ 7 pm to further discuss our plans for moving forward. We will update you as information becomes available. Please be sure to follow Hansen Jr/Sr High School and Hansen Elementary on Facebook as well

Hansen School District will be feeding children 1-18 yrs of age Monday thru Friday beginning March 30, 2020 at 11:00-12:00 on South side of High School in parking lot and Rock Creek General Store. Grab and go lunch and breakfast, for number of children in your home. You don’t need to be enrolled in Hansen School District to receive food. We will bring to your car door, do not get out of your cars please!

El distrito escolar de Hansen estará alimentando niños de 1 a 18 años de edad de Lunes a Viernes a partir del 30 de marzo,2020 de las 11:00-12: 00 en el lado sur de la escuela secundaria en estacionamiento y en el estacionamiento de gasolinera de Hansen. Ofrecerán desayuno y lonche, incluye todos los niños en su hogar. No necesita estar inscrito en distrito escolar de Hansen para recibir comida. Traeremos a la puerta de su automóvil, no salga de sus autos por favor!

After much discussion and deliberation with various government agencies, area school districts, and Hansen School District staff, we have made the decision to close school Tuesday and Wednesday of this week due to the concerns over the spread of the COVID-19 virus. School will remain closed until Monday, March 30th. All sports and extra-curricular activities have been suspended at this time. Any and all updated information regarding closure will be shared as soon as it becomes available through our social media accounts and by phone, text and email. This is an unprecedented situation, and we appreciate your patience and understanding as we respond to these circumstances, make difficult decisions and work to do what is best for our students, families, staff and community.

Después de mucha discusión y deliberación con varias agencias gubernamentales, distritos escolares del área y el personal del Distrito Escolar Hansen, hemos tomado la decisión de cerrar la escuela el martes y miércoles de esta semana debido a las preocupaciones sobre del que virus COVID-19 se pueda extender a los estudiantes. La escuela permanecerá cerrada hasta el lunes 30 de marzo. Todos los deportes y actividades extracurriculares han sido suspendidos en este momento. Toda la información actualizada sobre el cierramiento de las escuelas se compartirá tan pronto como esté disponible a través de nuestras cuentas de redes sociales y por teléfono, mensaje de texto y correo electrónico. Esta es una situación sin precedentes, y apreciamos su paciencia y comprensión mientras respondemos a estas circunstancias, tomamos decisiones difíciles y trabajamos para hacer lo mejor para nuestros estudiantes, familias, personal y comunidad.
